problem_statement: Our legacy Go-based Document Load Balancer is currently suffering from a lack of 'Architectural Rigor' and 'Observability Depth.' While the core proxying logic exists, the codebase does not follow our new corporate 'Middleware-First' design standards. Specifically, the system lacks structured telemetry, lacks a centralized configuration singleton, and utilizes memory structures (like temporaryStorage and configurationMap) that are not yet fully integrated into our 'State-Sync' lifecycle. We need to refactor this into a production-ready, thread-safe, and highly abstracted solution without losing any of the existing business logic constants or data structures
